intro: Anamomis dicrana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four lobes, resembling a tiny four-leaf clover. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds, ditches, and wetlands. Its rhizomes form dense mats on the water surface, contributing to water clarity by reducing algal growth. Anamomis dicrana plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
